author: Georgina Cruz, Special Correspondent
title: Family reunions for the holidays find a home at Florida resorts
text:
Walt Disney World Planning a family reunion for Thanksgiving or Christmas? Here are some ideas 
If this is the year that you are not going over the river and through the woods to grandmother’s house for a Thanksgiving or Christmas family reunion, you and grandma can consider a Florida getaway with lodging at a condo, villa or suite resort. 8 
Planning for this type of trip is important, as these reunions that offer opportunities to reconnect, catch up on each other’s lives and have fun together, can also be tricky to arrange successfully: the key is to select destinations and lodgings that offer pastimes for all age groups, and just as importantly, accommodations that feature space for the family to spread out: hence, suites, and condo- or villa-style apartments and resorts. The latter goes a long way to provide privacy for members of the group who may want it on occasion –let’s face it, too much togetherness may not be good for everyone all the time. And having space may promote harmony to help prevent a negative turn of events in the state of affairs that humorist Mark Twain described thusly: “I have found out that there ain’t no surer way to find out whether you like people or hate them than to travel with them.” 
Here are some Florida resorts at some popular spots of the Sunshine State, arranged alphabetically by resort name, that you can consider for your next family getaway vacation or reunion. Consult a travel agent or log on to each resort’s website for additional details and best rates available for the dates when you wish to travel. 
Bay Lake Tower at Disney’s Contemporary Resort, Orlando 0 
Description: A modern tower adjacent to the iconic Contemporary Resort and connected to it via a Sky Bridge, Bay Lake Tower is a Disney Vacation Club time-share property available for rental by non-members when space is available. Studios and multi-bedroom villas are ideal for family reunions and are equipped with kitchenettes in the studios and full kitchens and washers/dryers in the one-bedroom and highter villas. Some of the villas feature Magic Kingdom views so families can watch the nightly fireworks displays from their accommodations. 
Amenities: Pool with slide, movies under the stars, the dining and recreation options of the Contemporary Resort, including campfire program, and a monorail station at the Contemporary Resort for complimentary transportation to the Magic Kingdom, and with one transfer, to Epcot. There is complimentary Wi-Fi and parking. 
What’s Nearby: Four Disney theme parks (within walking distance to the Magic Kingdom), two Disney water parks, entertainment/dining/shopping districts at Disney World and other Orlando parks and attractions. 
Another option at the Disney World property are the family suites at the Art of Animation Resort, a hotel with landscapes celebrating the Disney-Pixar movies including “Finding Nemo,”“Cars” and “The Little Mermaid.” The family suites sleep up to six people, have a bedroom, living room, two bathrooms and kitchenette. 
Information: www.disneyworld.com . 
Casa Ybel Resort, Sanibel Island 
Description: A 23-acre beachfront landscaped resort on the quaint island of Sanibel in Southwest Florida, Casa Ybel has 114 one- and two-bedroom suites with beachfront views, screened lanai or balcony, kitchens, and separate living area with sleeper sofa. 
Amenities: Olympic-size beachfront swimming pool, tennis, beach volleyball and basketball, croquet, horseshoes and shuffleboard, Casa Kid’s Club and children’s pool. 
What’s Nearby: Shelling on 14 miles of Sanibel beaches, TheBailey-Matthews Shell Museum, J.N. “Ding” Darling Natural WildlifeRefuge, Sanibel Island Lighthouse and other attractions on Sanibel andneighboring Captiva Island. 
Information: www.casaybelresort.com . 
Hammock Beach Resort, Palm Coast 
Description: An oceanfront playground for families and other travelers with miles of beaches and accommodations that include one- to four-bedroom villas, condominiums and vacation homes. 
Amenities: A water park with a lazy river, water slides, pool and more as well as other amenities including two golf courses, spa, tennis courts, water sports, marina, and children’s club. Dining options include a seaside grill and sushi bar. 
What’s nearby: The attractions of both Daytona Beach, such as the Daytona International Speedway, and St. Augustine, including the Old City’s historic center, are near the resort, which is situated just north of Daytona Beach and just south of St. Augustine. 
Information: www.hammockbeach.com . 
Hawk’s Cay Resort, Duck Key, Florida Keys 
Description: A resort midway in the Keys, Hawk’s Cay offers in addition to other accommodations, two- and three-bedroom villas and vacation homes decorated in West Indies or Caribbean style. 
Amenities: Pools, tennis, water sports, marina, dolphin programs, spa, fitness center, multiple restaurants and bars, and children’s programs are among the amenities. 
What’s Nearby: Its central location in the chain of islands makes it possible to easily reach most of the Keys’ attractions including those in Key West, such as the Key West Aquarium, Key West Butterfly & Nature Conservatory, Mel Fisher’s Treasures and Hemingway and Audubon houses. 
Information: www.hawkscay.com . 
International Palms Resort, Cocoa Beach 
Description: On 13 acres along the beach, famous as the Surfing Capital of the East Coast, this resort features rooms, two-story lofts, suites and one-bedroom villa. “Family Fun Room” accommodations feature one king-size bed and partitioned area with two bunk beds and two televisions. 
Amenities: Pirate-ship-themed 150,000-gallon kids’ water park, whirlpool and outdoor pool, on-site dining, beach volleyball, surfboard and boogie board rental, arcade, tennis court, shuffleboard, corn hole court and half basketball court. 
What’s Nearby: Kennedy Space Center, Cocoa Beach Pier, Ron Jon Surf Shop, Merritt Island National Wildlife Refuge, Brevard Zoo and other Space Coast attractions including manatee watches. 
Information: www.internationalpalmscocoabeach.com . 
Palm Beach Shores Resort & Vacation Villas, Singer Island 
Description: An oceanfront resort on Singer Island, 55 miles north of Fort Lauderdale and 65 miles north of Miami, its accommodations include suites with two-room layouts and kitchens. 
Amenities: Swimming pool, hot tub, children’s pool, spa, fitness center, game room, restaurant and poolside tiki bar.
